content:
I reviewed [redacted name] today in the neuro-oncology follow-up clinic. The patient underwent gross total resection of a right lateral ventricle central neurocytoma in January 2023, with histology confirming WHO grade II disease, Ki-67 < 3% and positive synaptophysin staining. Post-operative MRI showed no residual disease, and the patient made an excellent recovery with no neurological deficits.

Surveillance MRI brain performed last week shows stable post-operative changes with no evidence of disease recurrence. The surgical cavity remains stable with expected post-treatment changes. No new lesions are identified.

The patient continues to do very well with no new neurological symptoms. Seizures remain well-controlled on levetiracetam monotherapy. We will continue with our surveillance protocol of 6-monthly MRI brain imaging for the first two years post-surgery, then annually thereafter if remains stable. Next review will be in 6 months with repeat imaging.

cancer_timeline.value: Gross total resection of right lateral ventricle tumor
Post-operative MRI showed no residual disease
Surveillance MRI brain shows stable post-operative changes with no evidence of disease recurrence

status_updates.value: WHO grade II central neurocytoma post complete resection. Stable disease on surveillance imaging with no clinical concerns
Stable post-operative changes on MRI with no evidence of recurrence
Continue 6-monthly MRI surveillance, next review in 6 months with imaging
